net.cloud.gfx.elements

Class TiledSprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.gfx.elements.AbstractElement
      • net.cloud.gfx.elements.Sprite
        • net.cloud.gfx.elements.TiledSprite
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Element, Focusable

    public class TiledSprite
extends Sprite
    A sprite which has its image tiled to match the width and height of the element. The image is stored and obtained just like with a regular Sprite element, but it will be a tiled variant and any change to the dimension of the element will re-tile the image.
    See Also:
    Sprite

    • Constructor Detail

      • TiledSprite

        public TiledSprite(int id,
                   int x,
                   int y,
                   int width,
                   int height)
        Create a new tiled sprite using the default sprite set. The sprite will be tiled and/or cropped to match the given width and height.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the sprite
        x - X location
        y - Y location
        width - Width of the element
        height - Height of the element

      • TiledSprite

        public TiledSprite(SpriteSet set,
                   int id,
                   int x,
                   int y,
                   int width,
                   int height)
        Create a new tiled sprite using the given sprite set. The sprite will be tiled and/or cropped to match the given width and height.
        Parameters:
        set - The sprite set to get the image from
        id - The ID of the sprite
        x - X location
        y - Y location
        width - Width of the element
        height - Height of the element

      • TiledSprite

        public TiledSprite(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                   int x,
                   int y,
                   int width,
                   int height)
        Create a new tiled sprite using the provided image. The sprite will be tiled and/or cropped to match the given width and height.
        Parameters:
        img - An image to use for this sprite. It will be tiled to form the sprite.
        x - X location
        y - Y location
        width - Width of the element
        height - Height of the element

    • Method Detail

      • changeImage

        public void changeImage(SpriteSet set,
                        int id)
        Change the sprite being shown. This is done via the sprite system, and may be done when there is no current sprite. This will not update the dimensions of the element, as those are defined for tiling the sprite.
        Overrides:
        changeImage in class Sprite
        Parameters:
        set - The set the sprite is in
        id - The ID of the sprite

      • changeImage

        public void changeImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
        Change the image being shown. This is done directly via a supplied image. This will not change the dimensions of the element.
        Overrides:
        changeImage in class Sprite
        Parameters:
        img - The image that will be shown

      • setRectangle

        public void setRectangle(java.awt.Rectangle r)
        Also sets the rectangle defining location and dimensions, but updates the image to once again be tiled to the new width and height.
        Specified by:
        setRectangle in interface Element
        Overrides:
        setRectangle in class AbstractElement
        Parameters:
        r - The entire location rectangle, all in one

      • setWidth

        public void setWidth(int width)
        Setting the width of a tiled sprite will re-tile the image so that it once again is tiled to the dimensions of the element
        Specified by:
        setWidth in interface Element
        Overrides:
